name: StrongBadZone GB
description:
Nineteen years ago, in the days of Macromedia Flash, a wrestleman named Strong Bad checked his email and talked about what he'd be like in a video game.

Among potential titles was Strong Bad Zone,  a vector game where a giant 3-D version of his head would shoot perplexing 3D geometric attacks at a cybershield guy.

The Sbemail was accompanied by playable flash versions of the games described, including Strong Bad Zone. It was instantly hailed as a classic, and earned Game Of the Year in every reputable gaming magazine.

This is a remake of Strong Bad Zone made using GB Studio. It should be completely playable on an actual Game Boy (or Videlectrix Pantsit) and on any other device that plays .gb files. You can also play it *right here* in your browser. Wow!

Controls:

Z and X are A and B and are used for selecting options.

Arrow keys or WASD to move. Press Up or W to put up your shield. Deflect attacks back at Strong Bad's giant head for points.

Features:

-Pixel Graphics

-Sound Clips

-Special Screen for Earning 1000 pts

-Lifelike Effects

This is a fan work based on Homestar Runner and is based on a flash game developed by The Brothers Chaps. Check out the original at https://homestarrunner.com/sbzone
